Candeo Hotels Osaka Namba
8.6 Excellent
Based on 802 reviews

I am a frenquent traveler, a hotelier and haven't seen a receptionist staff act like this staff, Hori Yuka ever I have booked this hotel with high expectation which I wanted to spend a nice honey moon trip with my hubby.

However, I realized that only 'run of the house' room category can be choose. I still made the reservation and wrote down under my request that I would like to have a King size bed as it's a honeymoon trip. When I arrived the hotel, one of the receptionist offered me a twin bed room, so I begged her to give me a twin room instead. Then this staff, Yuka shown up and told us that didn't I know what is meant by run of the house and asked me to pay more to get what I want. I kindly asked her to change the room tomorrow and she refused. I checked in at 4pm and I said the booking wasnt that cheap and I really want a king size bed and she said 'no actually you didn't book in a higher price' three times. I requested for a questionnaire form to fill in and she refused.

Show more
Yee , Hong Kong
Hotel Nikko Osaka
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2610 reviews

Hotel Nikko Osaka location is unbeatable. It is located on Sinshaibashi Dori ,just few minutes from the shopping arcade and Dotonbori.

We never got tired of walking through these areas every day and night. We were there end November and early December. The view of the autumn leaves of the gingko trees from the breakfast area was breathtaking. The breakfast selection was fantastic.The breakfast omelette the best we ever had! The hotel staff was genuinely warm and very attentive. Our room was spotless every time we returned from our day trip. The airport shuttle made our trip to the airport fuss free and comfortable. Thank you Hotel Nikko for making our second trip to Osaka filled with warm wonderful memories and making it one of our best memories of 2016!

Show more
Noridah , Singapore
Hotel Brighton City Osaka Kitahama
8.7 Excellent
Based on 2212 reviews

Room is smaller as describe. However, it has pretty much everything we need in a hotel room. Staffs are friendly and speak understandable english.

Location is very near to subway station however its not really the main station. There is big supermaket nearby which an added value besides 7-11 & Lawson being just 10 meter away from the hotel lobby. The hotel should add more washing/dryer machine considering they have more than 150 rooms and share one and only washing machine (thats pittyfull) There is not even a single english speaking channel on the TV satelite.

Show more
Tery , Indonesia
Onyado Nono Namba Natural Hot Spring
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 2584 reviews

I reviewed this hotel before i had the heart to book it. Located within walking distance from Nipponbashi station, Kuromon Market , Dotonbori and Shinshaibashi.

My friend and i arrived at 9 PM took the train from Kansai airport and exited thru the Nipponbashi station as instructed in our Google map app. We walked back and forth around the area locating the hotel but apparently there was no signage of the hotel i could read, it was all in Japanese characters. Would like to suggest a signage that could be appreciated by tourists and Japanese guests alike. With that initial difficulty everything paid off since the staff was so accommodating trying to help with every need. The room was small than what i was used to for two. Every need however was covered from ice to spoons and forks and chopsticks where one could get at the 5th floor. The only other difficulty was for us to remove our shoes whenever we go in and out of the hotel. Breakfast can have a change of menu. Very Good overall!!!

Show more
Jane , Philippines
Hotel Nikko Kansai Airport
8.7 Excellent
Based on 8196 reviews

This was the perfect choice for our family. Our flight arrival after 7pm and our stay would be in Kyoto, we decided to stay the night at Hotel Nikko Kansai.

Our family traveling as 6 adults and our 2 year old granddaughter, we decided after an 8 hour flight and basically a long day of travel preparations to stay on the airport property and then leave by train for Kyoto. It was so convenient to get to the hotel from arrival customs. The hotel staff was the perfect temperament after a long flight, very pleasant and accommodating since I also needed to break the larger yen bills that I had. Our rooms were clean, larger then I envisioned, quiet, the toiletries a plus and we had a nice restful sleep. No problem when we went on the hunt for a good meal. If you couldn't tell already, we highly recommend this hotel.

Show more
Joelyn , United States
Holiday Inn OSAKA NAMBA
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3444 reviews

I booked this hotel as a honeymoon gift for my brother and my new sister-in-law. They both liked the hotel and found it very convenient.

It is near the shopping area and with convenient stores right beside the hotel for their snacks and necessities. They also found this hotel more spacious that the hotel they got in Kyoto. Overall, my brother and sister-in-law were very happy with this hotel and it was just right for their honeymoon.

Show more
Joyce , Philippines
Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
8 Very good
Based on 6967 reviews

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel was very modern, clean and very spacious in comparison to Japanese hotels in general.

We were able to walk around comfortably without bumping into each other. Next door was a 7-eleven which was handy for our emergency supplies. It was a few steps to the main shopping strip - Dontombori, shinsaibashi, and Ebisu. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby. The entrance to thesubway station was outside the hotel. The only con is that we had to travel on the subway to get to Osaka/Umeda Station in order to catch any bullet trains to Kyoto and Osaka. This was difficult particularly when we both had 1 big suitcase and 1 big hand carry each. It was about a 15 minute walk from the Namba subway station to the hotel. We probably should have stayed close to Osaka/Umeda Station because we travelled to a few regions. If you're not traveling around then is fine. Overall a very nice, clean, spacious and modern hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Show more
Linda , Australia
Hotel Monterey Grasmere Osaka
8.3 Excellent
Based on 5873 reviews

Came from Tokyo and took shinkansen to shin-osaka station then took subway Midosuji line where we got off at Namba station.

Walked about 7mins to the hotel at exit 30. Hotel is connected to an underground mall called namba walk, where you can have access to the subway and jr train. Also located next door is OCAT bus station which can take you to and from kansai airport for a fee. Hotel has a very convenient, excellent location. Dotonbori is about 10mins walk from the hotel. To get there, you can take the underground mall and take exit 14 or 15 if you want to avoid the cold on the streets. Just below the hotel is a supermarket and lots of different restaurants. Breakfast spread is good, though we stayed for 3 days and it was pretty much the same. Hotel room was good enough size, bathroom clean with grooming amenities love the shiseido facial wash, some dust on the furniture not so bad, ionizer provided in the room. Staff helpful. Will definitely stay again.

Show more
Sherry , Philippines
Hotel Sunroute Osaka Namba
8.6 Excellent
Based on 3109 reviews

You can't beat the location being at the foot of dotonburi but upon our arrival we noticed how many loud and rude Chinese people there were.

We arrived in the morning so were not able to check-in. The staff who greeted us was quite pushy in trying to move us to the check-in counter after stopping us in the middle of the lobby. I didn't quite understand what she was trying to do until we realized she was a trainee. But still, isn't anyone supervising her? When finally able to check in, things went pretty smoothly. We had two adults and one child of one year. I explained that to the person checking in and she understood but when we got to the room, there were actually three double beds squooshed into one room! I couldn't believe my eyes. It was so tight in there and who would let a one year old sleep by themselves. Since we were there for just one night, we left it be. Everything else in the room was so-so and since we were just sleeping there for one night it was fine.

Show more
Joy , United States
Dormy Inn Premium Namba Natural Hot Spring
8.6 Excellent
Based on 3093 reviews

Very wonderful place to stay in Osaka. The hotel is clean. We are travelling with our baby and stayed in a family twin room which is bigger than the queen room.

The breakfast is better than some 4stars hotel. Good spread with Western and Japanese food. In the evening, the hotel provide complimentary ramen. The onsen is the main attraction. I prefer to visit in the afternoon when most guest are out. There is Family mart next to hotel, nearby to busy shopping area, lots to eat, lots to see, near subway. Overall, it's a happy place.

Show more
Mei , Singapore
Namba Oriental Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2661 reviews

Its a little more expensive but we love staying here. The rooms are almost western size rooms. Big for hotels in Asia.

Always clean and the staff is always very welcoming and polite during check in and check out. The location is fantastic. Its right in the middle of shopping, food, gambling, everything! Very near to the train station so it is convenient to get there from the airport and vise versa. There is a little garden area in the middle of the hotel that is open to the guests to sit and enjoy. However, be careful not to take any food or drinks into the area as that is a big no-no. The hotel is connected to a few shops and restaurants but you are more than likely to find what you are looking for in the area. You'll never be short of places to eat or places to shop around here. We stay here every time we travel to Namba.

Show more
Kiani , United States
Swissotel Nankai Osaka Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 4829 reviews

Hotel's location was great, placed in between shopping malls and walking distance to the famous Dotonburi, Namba station was just underground so we had no difficulties in navigation.

Takashimaya department store is just below the hotel, and there were a lot of pharmacies and restaurants nearby. Although i find it pricey for its room, and a 5 year old breakfast is chargeable, airport transfers were chargeable ( so they suggested us to take the Rapit train instead which takes about 48mins from airport to hotel, the hotel bell service were immediately sent as soon as we called them from their phonebooth at the Namba station); its the comfort that is worth the penny. Staffs were polite and helpful; Room service in the middle of the night was on time and housekeeping is good. They even upgraded us to their Swiss Advantage room with a good view of the city and sent us chocolates as it was a birthday trip. for those travelling with a child or infant, i recommended Swissotel Nankai Osaka.

Show more
Dawn , Philippines
Osaka Teikoku Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 2377 reviews

The hotel was located on one of the side streets which was 5 minutes away from Dontonbori where the night life was and the multiple selection of restaurants and market stalls.

The bed was big in size and there was plenty of floor space however, the bed sheets seemed very outdated and the bed was slightly on the soft side. The staff at reception was helpful and friendly. However, the only concern was coming out of the lift or entering through the doors to reception - the area smelt like cigarettes because they allow smokers to smoke on this floor and hence, to us the smell was very unpleasant if you plan to stay in the reception area for some time. Also, prior to leaving the hotel to explore Osaka - you must leave your hotel keys at the reception and request for them when you come back. This can be both a positive or negative aspect dependent on individual preference. Overall, if you're in Osaka for a short stay - this would be a good hotel based on the location.

Show more
Benjamin , Australia
Hotel IL Cuore Namba
8.3 Excellent
Based on 3539 reviews

I booked this hotel for my family on their trip. Location is the best quality of this hotel, being within walking distance from a lot of eating places, Takashimaya, the trains (the train from Osaka Airport goes directly to the station close to the hotel), Dotonbori, etc.

And although the district is very busy, the hotel is tucked in a quiet part of the area. The reception staff can speak English and was very helpful in calling a pocket wifi company on behalf of my brother (my brother wanted to know how to return the pocket wifi he rented in case the desk at the airport is still closed). The room has enough space in comparison to other Japanese hotels. But my family was not very happy with housekeeping. On their 2nd and 4th days at the hotel, the housekeeper did not clean the room, change the towels, fix the sheets and wash the cups. They had to complain before the housekeeping staff cleaned the room, and had to wait at the lobby while they cleaned. The experience would have been quite nice if not for this issue. Despite the housekeeping issue, I rated the service satisfactory because the housekeeping issue was balanced by the good reception staff. Otherwise, housekeeping would have caused the staff rating to go down to disappointing. The room did not have complimentary coffee; although, it had complimentary tea. I would like to give this hotel another try nonetheless.

Show more
Patrick , Philippines
Nest Hotel Osaka Shinsaibashi
7.8 Very good
Based on 3529 reviews

I had to go to Osaka for IT work, but since I'd just done a running event (Tokyo Yamathon 2016, 49K walk / run) the day before (a Saturday), decided to leave Tokyo Sunday and stay overnight.

The Nest Hotel is centrally located - I had a bit of spare time on arrival, and it was close enough on food to both Shinsaibashi-suji and Dotonburi, as well as Osaka Namba. And close enough to the relevant business offices to also make my way on work come Monday, a working day. Staff were mostly bilingual, and friendly. Hotel is nondescript, since I entered thru the back, which is really more for staff / deliveries. Facilities are OK, the room was small (13sqm) but I only had an overnight pack (my bog standard carry-on luggage, which I use on the shinkansen / "bullet train" as well). There is free wifi available if you need it. The system toilet / bath was clean, if dated (fixtures are new). Even managed a couple of really hot soaks of my tired feet. I'd use the place again to stay over when travelling alone, really mainly for the location. There are many nice eating places around, so you are really spoilt for choice cuisine-wise. Recommended!

Show more
Jeffrey , Philippines
APA Hotel Namba-Shinsaibashi
8 Very good
Based on 1522 reviews

Great location, near shopping, sightseeing, subway/trains, and food. I never had a bad meal in Osaka! Breakfast is good for selection and very good quality.

Typical Japanese breakfast items with some Western items. Room price is excellent if you book in advance. Be aware that the price goes up as the week goes on (it's cheaper on Sunday and Monday than on Friday and Saturday). By Western standards, the rooms are small. I'm 6'4" and can almost touch both walls in a Single Premium. (I'm pretty sure Premium is the same-sized room on the 13-15 floors). The bathroom is even smaller. One thing to remember is that the Japanese travel light and you can leave a lot of your toiletries at home. Soap, shampoo, conditioner, toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, brush, etc, is provided. There's a Family Mart a block down if you forgot anything, anyway. Plus a whole shopping district! I'll stay there again, maybe in a double, and bring the missus.

Show more
Patrick , United States
APA Hotel Namba-Eki Higashi
8.6 Excellent
Based on 585 reviews

The customer service by the lady executives is good in the afternoon. Even though they may struggle in English, you can see the effort to try as best they can to serve.

However, in the evening, as I went down to request for ironing facilities - I was informed that there is none by a male executive who was alright. To make matters worse, because of English limitation, this executive requested for the help of a senior, who most probably have better English mastery, who eventually made me feel looked down on, or that I am a foreigner hassle to him. I'd describe this executive as non-combed, almost bald headed. So not only is there no ironing facilities, the response from this executive also made me feel looked down. This has to be looked into by the APA Hotel Group itself. I realized this is more prevalent among male executives in Japan, as lady executives are usually rather courteous. I believe APA Hotel Group can look into this matter, as no one coming from another country and contributes to the nation's economy should deserve being treated in this manner.

Show more
Chong , Malaysia
Hotel Hankyu International
8.8 Excellent
Based on 719 reviews

We found our way from ShinOsaka to the hotel via subway on the Midosuji Line and then got off at Nikatsu Station.

Easy to find hotel and reception on 2nd floor. The Hotel Hanyu International was absolutely luxury for the price. Plenty of staff to greet you and make you feel very welcome and always exceptionally friendly but polite. We arrived early and couldn't check in until 2 pm which seems to be the normal at every Japanese hotel. No problems to leave bags and go sightseeing. On arrival back at the hotel we were escorted up to our luxurious room, shown how to connect to wifi, how to use TV, push button curtains and drapes etc. The extra pillows I requested at time of internet booking were waiting for us on arrival. Nothing was overlooked. The room on the 33 floor with a great view was spacious with two plush lounge chairs, desk and plenty of lighting and outlets to charge Ipad etc. Marble Bathroom is VERY big with both shower and bath with thick towels. The beds were comfortable (2doubles) however we found the pillows a bit too firm. Great surrounding area with 7/11 down nearby street, subway very close and easy to get around on the subway or JR line. We visited Osaka Castle which was OK. The castle and surrounding moat was impressive but the museum inside the castle wasn't as impressive. I would not hesitate to return to the Hotel Hankyu International as our stay was wonderful and a lovely hotel to return after a day of sightseeing. Loved this hotel.

Show more
Andrew , Australia
Best Western Hotel Fino Osaka Shinsaibashi
7.9 Very good
Based on 4292 reviews

This is the smallest room I have ever stayed in Japan. You can't even go in the same time you roll your luggage in because it is so tiny.

It feels like a walk-in closet. The biggest disappointment was the bathroom. I wanted to scrub the sink as you can see the dirt underneath and you can see the mold on the door, the walls. Very tight space whether you are in the bathroom or the bed. I stayed there for 3 nights and requested cleaning everyday and I don't think they even vacuumed the place since the same dirt I saw when we first checked in was there until we checked out. The reception desk wasn't at all receptive nor warm. I think for one night stay this is ok but for longer ones-book somewhere else. Definitely just good for a couple-don't even consider that a small family of 3 would fit because it won't. It is just way too compact.

Show more
Jasmin , United States
Premier Hotel -CABIN- Osaka
9 Excellent
Based on 540 reviews

The location very convenient, but no escalator or lift from the closest exit 2 of subway station, about 30 just next to the hotel.

OK if luggage not heavy. It took only 30minutes from Kansai airport to Tennoji via Haruka JR line. Changing from Tennoji JR station to subway station of Tanimachi line was a bit hectic, had to ask a staff and need to walk through a shopping mall. Difficult to find a lift. No signage at all, tried to look really hard for one and finally, a helpful supermarket staff showed us, as he could not speak English well. Turned out that lift access was across the road. Just one subway stop from Umeda and adjacent Osaka stations. Quiet residential area. The beginning of the longest shopping street is just across the road, shoppers mostly elderlies and moms with kids. When leaving for airport, as bags got so much heavier, decided to take taxi to Tennoji , about 2300 yen and around 20 minutes. Better than baggage delivery service to airport for 2500 yen each piece of luggage, but only accept up to 25Kg. The room seemed clean enough, but I and my hubby got a bug bite, only after the first night though. Counter staff very helpful but not everyone knew English well. No city phone call from room, had to use the public phone in the 24 hour convenience store round the corner to call a friend.

Show more
ronee , Hong Kong
Daiwa Roynet Hotel Osaka-Uehonmachi
8.7 Excellent
Based on 1010 reviews

We had a very pleasant three-night stay at Daiwa Roynet Hotel Uehonmachi. The hotel is fairly new, the rooms and bathrooms were pristine, and the bed and beddings were very comfortable.

Location-wise, there was a supermarket next door and two convenience stores nearby. There was also a Don Quijote less than 5 minutes away by foot. If one needs to shop, the nearby Kintetsu mall, which is three-minute walk from the hotel, has Uniqlo, Muji, and ABC Mart branches, among others. It's not as close to Dotonbori or central Osaka as we would've liked, but it's still just a train station away. The hotel staff were efficient and helpful. There's free wi-fi access in the rooms and in the reception area. The care packages for the ladies were an extra special and thoughtful touch. All in all, our group of six adults, one kid, and one baby thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

My husband and I stayed in New Hankyu hotel Osaka for 6 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

The breakfast spread has wide varieties from Japanese to Western cuisine which we enjoyed during our stay but the chef doesn't change the dishes so by the 4th day we were a bit bored with the breakfast selection since it's the same everyday. It was initially difficult to find the place as it's not on Google Maps. I landed up in Tiara Court East and could not find Tiara Court West until a tenant from Tiara Court East gave me directions.

Important to note, Tiara Court West is along the MAIN ROAD, just a right turn away from its sibling. It takes 3 minutes or less to walk from the apartment building to the Hanazonocho subway station. It was easy and takes about 30-40 mins to get from here to places like Shimbashi, Dotonburi, Kaiyukan and Universal Studios. Also about 50 minutes from Kansai Intl Airport if you go by Hanazonocho station to take the Haruka at Tennoji. Although I had a 19.4 kg luggage and two smaller bags, and had to climb 3 flights of stairs, the route was manageable. The apartment is also near a supermarket and a pharmacy; and for those in need of some familiarity, McDonald's is nearby too. Otherwise, the place is small, cozy and equipped with necessary electrical appliances (air pot, rice cooker, stove, refrigerator, etc) and basic toiletries to make your stay as homely as possible. I would however suggest for the hotel to provide bath towels. The WIFI connection in the apartment I stayed in was very weak and could only be found if I stood at a particular position in the apartment. Not great when one's trying to limit the paid data usage. However, I must commend the staff for responding quickly to my feedback about the WIFI. Unfortunately, he wasn't able to help much. Overall, a great stay.

More about Osaka

Having gotten its start in the 1500s when its grand castle was built, Japan's second-largest city is still a place where locals appreciate the value of fine foods and designer goods. While Osaka can't compete with Tokyo in terms of scale, it certainly has a reputation for refined living.

Most of the hotels in Osaka are in Umeda, near the bullet train station. These include major international names set in prominent entertainment districts. These hotels are convenient choices for business travelers as well as tourists.

On the surface, Osaka looks like any other big city, but it hides a mammoth shopping arcade underground. A couple of these are among the largest malls in Japan, and they're completely out of sight. Above-ground boutiques are also located in the Namba and Shinsaibashi districts. Osaka Castle, a Universal Studios theme park, and the enormous Osaka Aquarium are some of the city’s major attractions.

Osaka's international gateway is Kansai International Airport. The main terminal is a mile long and well equipped with dining and shopping facilities as well as a rail link to the city center.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Osaka for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

However, I realized that only 'run of the house' room category can be choose. I still made the reservation and wrote down under my request that I would like to have a King size bed as it's a honeymoon trip. When I arrived the hotel, one of the receptionist offered me a twin bed room, so I begged her to give me a twin room instead. Then this staff, Yuka shown up and told us that didn't I know what is meant by run of the house and asked me to pay more to get what I want. I kindly asked her to change the room tomorrow and she refused. I checked in at 4pm and I said the booking wasnt that cheap and I really want a king size bed and she said 'no actually you didn't book in a higher price' three times. I requested for a questionnaire form to fill in and she refused. Show more Yee , Hong Kong Hotel Nikko Osaka 8.6 Excellent Based on 2610 reviews Hotel Nikko Osaka location is unbeatable. It is located on Sinshaibashi Dori ,just few minutes from the shopping arcade and Dotonbori. We never got tired of walking through these areas every day and night. We were there end November and early December. The view of the autumn leaves of the gingko trees from the breakfast area was breathtaking. The breakfast selection was fantastic.The breakfast omelette the best we ever had! The hotel staff was genuinely warm and very attentive. Our room was spotless every time we returned from our day trip. The airport shuttle made our trip to the airport fuss free and comfortable. Thank you Hotel Nikko for making our second trip to Osaka filled with warm wonderful memories and making it one of our best memories of 2016! Show more Noridah , Singapore Hotel Brighton City Osaka Kitahama 8.7 Excellent Based on 2212 reviews Room is smaller as describe. However, it has pretty much everything we need in a hotel room. Staffs are friendly and speak understandable english. Location is very near to subway station however its not really the main station. There is big supermaket nearby which an added value besides 7-11 & Lawson being just 10 meter away from the hotel lobby. The hotel should add more washing/dryer machine considering they have more than 150 rooms and share one and only washing machine (thats pittyfull) There is not even a single english speaking channel on the TV satelite. Show more Tery , Indonesia Onyado Nono Namba Natural Hot Spring 9.1 Exceptional Based on 2584 reviews I reviewed this hotel before i had the heart to book it. Located within walking distance from Nipponbashi station, Kuromon Market , Dotonbori and Shinshaibashi. My friend and i arrived at 9 PM took the train from Kansai airport and exited thru the Nipponbashi station as instructed in our Google map app. We walked back and forth around the area locating the hotel but apparently there was no signage of the hotel i could read, it was all in Japanese characters. Would like to suggest a signage that could be appreciated by tourists and Japanese guests alike. With that initial difficulty everything paid off since the staff was so accommodating trying to help with every need. The room was small than what i was used to for two. Every need however was covered from ice to spoons and forks and chopsticks where one could get at the 5th floor. The only other difficulty was for us to remove our shoes whenever we go in and out of the hotel. Breakfast can have a change of menu. Very Good overall!!! Show more Jane , Philippines Hotel Nikko Kansai Airport 8.7 Excellent Based on 8196 reviews This was the perfect choice for our family. Our flight arrival after 7pm and our stay would be in Kyoto, we decided to stay the night at Hotel Nikko Kansai. Our family traveling as 6 adults and our 2 year old granddaughter, we decided after an 8 hour flight and basically a long day of travel preparations to stay on the airport property and then leave by train for Kyoto. It was so convenient to get to the hotel from arrival customs. The hotel staff was the perfect temperament after a long flight, very pleasant and accommodating since I also needed to break the larger yen bills that I had. Our rooms were clean, larger then I envisioned, quiet, the toiletries a plus and we had a nice restful sleep. No problem when we went on the hunt for a good meal. If you couldn't tell already, we highly recommend this hotel. Show more Joelyn , United States Holiday Inn OSAKA NAMBA 8.4 Excellent Based on 3444 reviews I booked this hotel as a honeymoon gift for my brother and my new sister-in-law. They both liked the hotel and found it very convenient. It is near the shopping area and with convenient stores right beside the hotel for their snacks and necessities. They also found this hotel more spacious that the hotel they got in Kyoto. Overall, my brother and sister-in-law were very happy with this hotel and it was just right for their honeymoon. Show more Joyce , Philippines Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba 8 Very good Based on 6967 reviews My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel was very modern, clean and very spacious in comparison to Japanese hotels in general. We were able to walk around comfortably without bumping into each other. Next door was a 7-eleven which was handy for our emergency supplies. It was a few steps to the main shopping strip - Dontombori, shinsaibashi, and Ebisu. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby. The entrance to thesubway station was outside the hotel. The only con is that we had to travel on the subway to get to Osaka/Umeda Station in order to catch any bullet trains to Kyoto and Osaka. This was difficult particularly when we both had 1 big suitcase and 1 big hand carry each. It was about a 15 minute walk from the Namba subway station to the hotel. We probably should have stayed close to Osaka/Umeda Station because we travelled to a few regions. If you're not traveling around then is fine. Overall a very nice, clean, spacious and modern hotel. We would definitely stay here again. Show more Linda , Australia Hotel Monterey Grasmere Osaka 8.3 Excellent Based on 5873 reviews Came from Tokyo and took shinkansen to shin-osaka station then took subway Midosuji line where we got off at Namba station. Walked about 7mins to the hotel at exit 30. Hotel is connected to an underground mall called namba walk, where you can have access to the subway and jr train. Also located next door is OCAT bus station which can take you to and from kansai airport for a fee. Hotel has a very convenient, excellent location. Dotonbori is about 10mins walk from the hotel. To get there, you can take the underground mall and take exit 14 or 15 if you want to avoid the cold on the streets. Just below the hotel is a supermarket and lots of different restaurants. Breakfast spread is good, though we stayed for 3 days and it was pretty much the same. Hotel room was good enough size, bathroom clean with grooming amenities love the shiseido facial wash, some dust on the furniture not so bad, ionizer provided in the room. Staff helpful. Will definitely stay again. Show more Sherry , Philippines Hotel Sunroute Osaka Namba 8.6 Excellent Based on 3109 reviews You can't beat the location being at the foot of dotonburi but upon our arrival we noticed how many loud and rude Chinese people there were. We arrived in the morning so were not able to check-in. The staff who greeted us was quite pushy in trying to move us to the check-in counter after stopping us in the middle of the lobby. I didn't quite understand what she was trying to do until we realized she was a trainee. But still, isn't anyone supervising her? When finally able to check in, things went pretty smoothly. We had two adults and one child of one year. I explained that to the person checking in and she understood but when we got to the room, there were actually three double beds squooshed into one room! I couldn't believe my eyes. It was so tight in there and who would let a one year old sleep by themselves. Since we were there for just one night, we left it be. Everything else in the room was so-so and since we were just sleeping there for one night it was fine. Show more Joy , United States Dormy Inn Premium Namba Natural Hot Spring 8.6 Excellent Based on 3093 reviews Very wonderful place to stay in Osaka. The hotel is clean. We are travelling with our baby and stayed in a family twin room which is bigger than the queen room. The breakfast is better than some 4stars hotel. Good spread with Western and Japanese food. In the evening, the hotel provide complimentary ramen. The onsen is the main attraction. I prefer to visit in the afternoon when most guest are out. There is Family mart next to hotel, nearby to busy shopping area, lots to eat, lots to see, near subway. Overall, it's a happy place. Show more Mei , Singapore Namba Oriental Hotel 8.4 Excellent Based on 2661 reviews Its a little more expensive but we love staying here. The rooms are almost western size rooms. Big for hotels in Asia. Always clean and the staff is always very welcoming and polite during check in and check out. The location is fantastic. Its right in the middle of shopping, food, gambling, everything! Very near to the train station so it is convenient to get there from the airport and vise versa. There is a little garden area in the middle of the hotel that is open to the guests to sit and enjoy. However, be careful not to take any food or drinks into the area as that is a big no-no. The hotel is connected to a few shops and restaurants but you are more than likely to find what you are looking for in the area. You'll never be short of places to eat or places to shop around here. We stay here every time we travel to Namba. Show more Kiani , United States Swissotel Nankai Osaka Hotel 8.8 Excellent Based on 4829 reviews Hotel's location was great, placed in between shopping malls and walking distance to the famous Dotonburi, Namba station was just underground so we had no difficulties in navigation. Takashimaya department store is just below the hotel, and there were a lot of pharmacies and restaurants nearby. Although i find it pricey for its room, and a 5 year old breakfast is chargeable, airport transfers were chargeable ( so they suggested us to take the Rapit train instead which takes about 48mins from airport to hotel, the hotel bell service were immediately sent as soon as we called them from their phonebooth at the Namba station); its the comfort that is worth the penny. Staffs were polite and helpful; Room service in the middle of the night was on time and housekeeping is good. They even upgraded us to their Swiss Advantage room with a good view of the city and sent us chocolates as it was a birthday trip. for those travelling with a child or infant, i recommended Swissotel Nankai Osaka. Show more Dawn , Philippines Osaka Teikoku Hotel 7.9 Very good Based on 2377 reviews The hotel was located on one of the side streets which was 5 minutes away from Dontonbori where the night life was and the multiple selection of restaurants and market stalls. The bed was big in size and there was plenty of floor space however, the bed sheets seemed very outdated and the bed was slightly on the soft side. The staff at reception was helpful and friendly. However, the only concern was coming out of the lift or entering through the doors to reception - the area smelt like cigarettes because they allow smokers to smoke on this floor and hence, to us the smell was very unpleasant if you plan to stay in the reception area for some time. Also, prior to leaving the hotel to explore Osaka - you must leave your hotel keys at the reception and request for them when you come back. This can be both a positive or negative aspect dependent on individual preference. Overall, if you're in Osaka for a short stay - this would be a good hotel based on the location. Show more Benjamin , Australia Hotel IL Cuore Namba 8.3 Excellent Based on 3539 reviews I booked this hotel for my family on their trip. Location is the best quality of this hotel, being within walking distance from a lot of eating places, Takashimaya, the trains (the train from Osaka Airport goes directly to the station close to the hotel), Dotonbori, etc. And although the district is very busy, the hotel is tucked in a quiet part of the area. The reception staff can speak English and was very helpful in calling a pocket wifi company on behalf of my brother (my brother wanted to know how to return the pocket wifi he rented in case the desk at the airport is still closed). The room has enough space in comparison to other Japanese hotels. But my family was not very happy with housekeeping. On their 2nd and 4th days at the hotel, the housekeeper did not clean the room, change the towels, fix the sheets and wash the cups. They had to complain before the housekeeping staff cleaned the room, and had to wait at the lobby while they cleaned. The experience would have been quite nice if not for this issue. Despite the housekeeping issue, I rated the service satisfactory because the housekeeping issue was balanced by the good reception staff. Otherwise, housekeeping would have caused the staff rating to go down to disappointing. The room did not have complimentary coffee; although, it had complimentary tea. I would like to give this hotel another try nonetheless. Show more Patrick , Philippines Nest Hotel Osaka Shinsaibashi 7.8 Very good Based on 3529 reviews I had to go to Osaka for IT work, but since I'd just done a running event (Tokyo Yamathon 2016, 49K walk / run) the day before (a Saturday), decided to leave Tokyo Sunday and stay overnight. The Nest Hotel is centrally located - I had a bit of spare time on arrival, and it was close enough on food to both Shinsaibashi-suji and Dotonburi, as well as Osaka Namba. And close enough to the relevant business offices to also make my way on work come Monday, a working day. Staff were mostly bilingual, and friendly. Hotel is nondescript, since I entered thru the back, which is really more for staff / deliveries. Facilities are OK, the room was small (13sqm) but I only had an overnight pack (my bog standard carry-on luggage, which I use on the shinkansen / "bullet train" as well). There is free wifi available if you need it. The system toilet / bath was clean, if dated (fixtures are new). Even managed a couple of really hot soaks of my tired feet. I'd use the place again to stay over when travelling alone, really mainly for the location. There are many nice eating places around, so you are really spoilt for choice cuisine-wise. Recommended! Show more Jeffrey , Philippines APA Hotel Namba-Shinsaibashi 8 Very good Based on 1522 reviews Great location, near shopping, sightseeing, subway/trains, and food. I never had a bad meal in Osaka! Breakfast is good for selection and very good quality. Typical Japanese breakfast items with some Western items. Room price is excellent if you book in advance. Be aware that the price goes up as the week goes on (it's cheaper on Sunday and Monday than on Friday and Saturday). By Western standards, the rooms are small. I'm 6'4" and can almost touch both walls in a Single Premium. (I'm pretty sure Premium is the same-sized room on the 13-15 floors). The bathroom is even smaller. One thing to remember is that the Japanese travel light and you can leave a lot of your toiletries at home. Soap, shampoo, conditioner, toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, brush, etc, is provided. There's a Family Mart a block down if you forgot anything, anyway. Plus a whole shopping district! I'll stay there again, maybe in a double, and bring the missus. Show more Patrick , United States APA Hotel Namba-Eki Higashi 8.6 Excellent Based on 585 reviews The customer service by the lady executives is good in the afternoon. Even though they may struggle in English, you can see the effort to try as best they can to serve. However, in the evening, as I went down to request for ironing facilities - I was informed that there is none by a male executive who was alright. To make matters worse, because of English limitation, this executive requested for the help of a senior, who most probably have better English mastery, who eventually made me feel looked down on, or that I am a foreigner hassle to him. I'd describe this executive as non-combed, almost bald headed. So not only is there no ironing facilities, the response from this executive also made me feel looked down. This has to be looked into by the APA Hotel Group itself. I realized this is more prevalent among male executives in Japan, as lady executives are usually rather courteous. I believe APA Hotel Group can look into this matter, as no one coming from another country and contributes to the nation's economy should deserve being treated in this manner. Show more Chong , Malaysia Hotel Hankyu International 8.8 Excellent Based on 719 reviews We found our way from ShinOsaka to the hotel via subway on the Midosuji Line and then got off at Nikatsu Station. Easy to find hotel and reception on 2nd floor. The Hotel Hanyu International was absolutely luxury for the price. Plenty of staff to greet you and make you feel very welcome and always exceptionally friendly but polite. We arrived early and couldn't check in until 2 pm which seems to be the normal at every Japanese hotel. No problems to leave bags and go sightseeing. On arrival back at the hotel we were escorted up to our luxurious room, shown how to connect to wifi, how to use TV, push button curtains and drapes etc. The extra pillows I requested at time of internet booking were waiting for us on arrival. Nothing was overlooked. The room on the 33 floor with a great view was spacious with two plush lounge chairs, desk and plenty of lighting and outlets to charge Ipad etc. Marble Bathroom is VERY big with both shower and bath with thick towels. The beds were comfortable (2doubles) however we found the pillows a bit too firm. Great surrounding area with 7/11 down nearby street, subway very close and easy to get around on the subway or JR line. We visited Osaka Castle which was OK. The castle and surrounding moat was impressive but the museum inside the castle wasn't as impressive. I would not hesitate to return to the Hotel Hankyu International as our stay was wonderful and a lovely hotel to return after a day of sightseeing. Loved this hotel. Show more Andrew , Australia Best Western Hotel Fino Osaka Shinsaibashi 7.9 Very good Based on 4292 reviews This is the smallest room I have ever stayed in Japan. I wanted to scrub the sink as you can see the dirt underneath and you can see the mold on the door, the walls. Very tight space whether you are in the bathroom or the bed. I stayed there for 3 nights and requested cleaning everyday and I don't think they even vacuumed the place since the same dirt I saw when we first checked in was there until we checked out. The reception desk wasn't at all receptive nor warm. I think for one night stay this is ok but for longer ones-book somewhere else. Definitely just good for a couple-don't even consider that a small family of 3 would fit because it won't. It is just way too compact. Changing from Tennoji JR station to subway station of Tanimachi line was a bit hectic, had to ask a staff and need to walk through a shopping mall. Difficult to find a lift. No signage at all, tried to look really hard for one and finally, a helpful supermarket staff showed us, as he could not speak English well. Turned out that lift access was across the road. Just one subway stop from Umeda and adjacent Osaka stations. Quiet residential area. The beginning of the longest shopping street is just across the road, shoppers mostly elderlies and moms with kids. When leaving for airport, as bags got so much heavier, decided to take taxi to Tennoji , about 2300 yen and around 20 minutes. Better than baggage delivery service to airport for 2500 yen each piece of luggage, but only accept up to 25Kg. The room seemed clean enough, but I and my hubby got a bug bite, only after the first night though. Counter staff very helpful but not everyone knew English well. Show more ronee , Hong Kong Daiwa Roynet Hotel Osaka-Uehonmachi 8.7 Excellent Based on 1010 reviews We had a very pleasant three-night stay at Daiwa Roynet Hotel Uehonmachi. The hotel is fairly new, the rooms and bathrooms were pristine, and the bed and beddings were very comfortable. Location-wise, there was a supermarket next door and two convenience stores nearby. There was also a Don Quijote less than 5 minutes away by foot. If one needs to shop, the nearby Kintetsu mall, which is three-minute walk from the hotel, has Uniqlo, Muji, and ABC Mart branches, among others. It's not as close to Dotonbori or central Osaka as we would've liked, but it's still just a train station away. The hotel staff were efficient and helpful. There's free wi-fi access in the rooms and in the reception area. The care packages for the ladies were an extra special and thoughtful touch. All in all, our group of six adults, one kid, and one baby thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Show more Anna , Philippines Hotel New Hankyu Osaka 8.1 Excellent Based on 3037 reviews My husband and I stayed in New Hankyu hotel Osaka for 6 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The hotel provided complimentary items for ladies only based on number of nights stay so I get to select from cleaning oil to eyes mask or herbs pad, what a pleasant surprise. The room wasn't big as expected but it's spacious enough to put our 2 big luggage and a cabin bag. Overall we're satisfied with our stay and will definitely come back again when we visit Osaka in future. Show more Hui , Malaysia The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan™ 9.1 Exceptional Based on 1789 reviews Best hotel to be if the main purpose of your Osaka vacation is to go to Universal Studios. I am very particular of hotel locations because my daughter has difficulty walking and I don't want to stress her out by walking long distances. Our stay was overall pleasant except that we had to get a private van to bring us to the airport because the earliest bus available is at 9am. The bus, had it been available at an earlier time, would have only cost us around 7000 Yen. from my first trip there i was quite familiar with the area around dotonbori and shinsaibashi. i could have picked accommodations that was more familiar and i would have deemed nearer dotonbori/shinsaibashi area. i was glad to have chosen 88 hotel shinsaibashi instead amongst the other more popularly known hotel around namba city. i would say 88 hotel shinsaibashi seems more of a boutique hotel rather than the usual hotel that offers all facilities that one usually has. although, just like a regular hotel, complimentary water and toiletries gets to be replenished everyday. the mn. they also have 3 massage chairs which are most welcoming going back to the hotel after a very tiring tour at the end of each day. another advantage of this property is that since it is just a 8 days of stay at that hotel, each day that we came back to our room it was always impeccably clean. on its location, it is very convenient since it is a five minute walk to dotonbori/shin sai bashi area and a minute walk to an entrance of "the walk" an underground shopping area and has access to all the train lines within the namba station. lastly, my review for the hotel's staff should be written. they are very accommodating and courteous as expected from japanese and they speak English. i believe that in every trip, communication amongst different nations is very important because it can make your trip very comfortable. Show more Eugenio , Philippines Dormy Inn Umeda Higashi Natural Hot Spring 8.3 Excellent Based on 977 reviews Initially we can't find the place therefore please note that upon Exit 2 of Minamimorimachi Station, turn left and walk straight. Please note at Exit 2 there is no elevator so we have to lug our luggage up 2 short flight of stairs. 3rd left and you will see the hotel, it is actually quite near to the station. As we are not big sized, we eventually got used to the bed. The great things about this hotel is that it has an onsen on the 8th floor which was great after a long day of sightseeing and shopping and it does not close throughout the night till then next morn at 10 am. The hotel is very near to Namba Nankai station and we took a cab on a weekday to Namba Nankai to catch the Kintetsu train to the airport and it cost only 900yen! Money well spent to save the hustle of walking down the flight of steps at the station with more shopping/heavier luggages. It was a pleasant hotel and two of the Japanese receptionists were very helpful and courteous and help us to book a cab to Namba. Electric kettle was't working, so we had to make do with the microwave for making coffee. We had to buy our own mugs as the 2 substandard plastic cups provided were not microwave oven safe. 3. Beds, one of the mattress was way beyond it's useful life, too soft and sagging., the other was near the end of it's service. 4. Totally void of service from the owner, and didn't have the courtesy to reply us, when we informed her(via text message) of our checking out and having done the necessary to return the keys. Having all said that, a seasoned traveler can make do ... but do not expect too much or you'll be disappointed. While Osaka can't compete with Tokyo in terms of scale, it certainly has a reputation for refined living. Most of the hotels in Osaka are in Umeda, near the bullet train station. These include major international names set in prominent entertainment districts. These hotels are convenient choices for business travelers as well as tourists. On the surface, Osaka looks like any other big city, but it hides a mammoth shopping arcade underground. A couple of these are among the largest malls in Japan, and they're completely out of sight. Above-ground boutiques are also located in the Namba and Shinsaibashi districts. Osaka Castle , a Universal Studios theme park, and the enormous Osaka Aquarium are some of the city’s major attractions. Osaka's international gateway is Kansai International Airport . The main terminal is a mile long and well equipped with dining and shopping facilities as well as a rail link to the city center. Be sure to check out the interactive map of Osaka for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.
